publicationstmt.publisher: Medical Historical Library, Harvey Cushing / John Hay Whitney Medical Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday March 27, 2019 at 02:00

repository.corpname: Medical Historical Library, Harvey Cushing / John Hay Whitney Medical Library

langmaterial.language: Almanacs are mostly in English with examples of German, French, and Swedish.

did.abstract: The collection contains almanacs issued annually by American and a few Canadian companies to promote the sale of their proprietary remedies. Of special note is a complete collection of Hostetter's Almanac from 1867 through 1910.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Almanacs in the first series have been arranged by short title. Titles of almanacs often vary from year to year. Depending on the consistency, titles may fall in more than one place with cross references. Sometimes variant titles have been grouped. Pamphlets in the second series have been retained in the order established by the collector.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The almanacs in this collection were issued annually by American and a few Canadian companies to promote the sale of their proprietary remedies. The remedies were secret rather than actually patented, and exaggerated claims were made for what they could cure. Almanacs were distributed free to customers by drug stores. Typically the back cover of the almanac carried an advertisement for an individual pharmacy. Often the almanacs had a hole at the top left, through which a string was tied so that they could be hung on a nail on the wall. Two almanacs are in miniature format.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Some almanacs were transferred from Sterling Memorial Library in the 1940s. Many others were donated by William H. Helfand. The Supplement contains additional almanacs and a few other patent medicine pamphlets collected by Lloyd Moore and donated by his daughter Kathi Moore Sherman in 2018.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The dates supplied are the years that the almanacs cover, not the year of publication, which might be the year before. Many almanacs do not have formal publication information.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related collections at the Medical Historical Library include the Sheet music collection on medical themes (Pam Coll 5), the Medical trade card collection (Pam Coll 6), and the William Helfand collection of medical ephemera (Pam Coll 8).

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Some patent medicine almanacs in the Medical Historical Library have been cataloged separately on Orbis. For titles in this collection, the existence of other issues has been noted. Other titles not represented include Hop Bitters Almanac for 1877, Brayley's Family Medical Almanac 1883, Kickapoo Almanac, 1893, and "Rough on Rats" 1884 Almanac.

did.unittitle: Supplement from the collection of Lloyd Moore

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These almanacs, housed in three notebooks, were collected by Professor Lloyd Moore (1916-2004). Moore was a graduate of Columbia University (1939) and the Brooklyn College of Pharmacy (1944). He was an active member of the American Pharmaceutical Association. His collection of almanacs and other medical ephemera was used as part of his lectures at the Brooklyn College of Pharmacy and Nassau Community College.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full title is Hostetter's Illustrated United States Almanac for Merchants, Mechanics, Miners, Farmers, Planters and General Family Use. This volume contains a complete set of almanacs from 1867 through 1899. Published by Hostetter & Smith, Pittsburgh through 1885. Published by Hostetter & Co., Pittsburgh, 1886-1890. Published by the Hostetter Company, Pittsburgh, 1891-1899. The main product advertised was Hostetter's Stomach Bitters.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Complete set of almanacs from 1900 to 1910, published by the Hostetter Company, Pittsburgh, Pa.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Items maintained in the order established by the collector, Professor Moore, who created an index to them.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Published by G. G. Green, Woodbury, New Jersey. Advertises Boschee's German Syrup, Green's August Flower, and Green's Ague Conqueror.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Published by the Barker, Moore & Mein Medicine Company, Philadelphia. Advertises Barker's Nerve and Bone Liniment and Barker's Horse, Cattle & Poultry Powder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Published by Merchant's Gargling Oil Company, Lockport, New York. Advertises Merchant's Gargling Oil Liniment, "a liniment for man and beast."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Published by Jeremiah Curtis & Sons, Boston, and John I. Brown & Sons, New York. Advertises Mrs. Winslow's Soothing Syrup, a remedy for infants that contained opium; Brown's Bronchial Troches, Brown's Vermifuge Confits, Brown's Household Panacea, and Brown's Camphorated Saponaceous Dentifrice. The pamphlet contains recipes for meals and for household use.

did.unittitle: Doan's Directory of the United States

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Published by the Foster-Milburn Co., Buffalo, New York. The Directory lists the population of every town in the United States with over 1000 people. The pamphlet advertises Doan's Kidney Pills and other medications.

did.unittitle: Doan's Directory of the U.S. with Latest Census of Large Cities
Doan's Directory of the Unites States, Latest Edition

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Advertises Doan's Pills, "stimulant diuretic to the kidneys," and other medications.

did.unittitle: Doan's Directory of the United States, Latest Edition
Dr. D. Jayne's Medical Almanac and Guide to Health

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Published by Dr. D. Jayne & Son, Philadelphia. Advertises Dr. D. Jayne's Family Medicines including Expectorant, Tonic Vermifuge, Specific for Tape Worm, Carminative Balsam, Alterative, Liniment or Counter Irritant, Sanative Pills, and Hair Tonic.

did.unittitle: Vinegar Bitters Almanac: Devoted to Temperance, Health and Economy

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Published by R. H. McDonald & Co., Druggists and General Agents, San Francisco. Advertises Dr. Walker's California Vinegar Bitters, the "only temperance bitters known."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "Published by the Proprietors of Dr. Herrick's Family Medicine," New York. Advertises Herrick's Sugar-Coated Vegetable Liver Pills, Renne's Pain-Killing Magic Oil, Dr. Herrick's German Horse Liniment, Harvell's Condition Powders (also veterinary), and various Herrick's plasters.

did.unittitle: Burdock Blood Bitters Almanac and Key to Health

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Published by Foster, Milburn & Co., Buffalo, New York. Advertises Burdock Blood Bitters (B.B.B.) and Dr. Thomas' Electric Oil.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Published by the World's Dispensary Medical Association, Buffalo, New York. Advertises Dr. Pierce's Standard Medicines. Pierce is Dr. R. V. Pierce.

did.unittitle: Epilepsy (Fits) and St. Vitus's Dance (Chorea). World Dispensary Dime Series

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: R. V. Pierce, M.D. was consulting physician to the Invalids' Hotel and Surgical Institute, Buffalo, New York. This publication advertises the institution and its successful cases.
